page.title: 14ST. CLEMENT'S WELL
page.content: WE WENT TO ST.CLEMENT'S WELL EXPECTING TO SEE A WATER WELL.WE COULD NOT FIND ONE.WE SAW A TALL SQUARE BUILDING. INSIDE WE SAW LOTS OF LITTLE NEST BOXES.THERE HAD BEEN A ROOF BUT IT HAD FALLEN IN.THERE WERE SMALL HOLES NEAR THE TOP.WE DECIDED IT WAS PROBABLY A DOOCOT_A PLACE TO KEEP PIGEONS. NEARBY WAS AN OLD UNUSED PETROL PUMP. LONG AGO THE PUMP WAS PROBABLY USED TO REFUEL THE FARMERS TRACTOR. WE SAW AN OLD RUINED FARMHOUSE AND BARN. THE GARDEN WAS VERY OVERGROWN BUT WE SAW PANSIES,VIOLETS,LUPINS AND CLOVER.ON THE WAY BACK WE MET A MAN WHO TOLD US THERE HAD BEEN A BREWERY NEARBY. THE BREWERY WAS WHERE THE NEW HOUSES STAND.A BREWERY REQUIRES WATER.WE THINK PERHAPS THE WATER CAME FROM ST.CLEMENT'S WELL,BUT WE ARE NOT SURE.
